common.unknown_stage_desc: The specified grand stage could not be found.
common.stage_not_implemented: The level definitions for this grand stage have not yet been implemented in the app.

top.hint: Grand stages are unlocked sequentially. To proceed to the next grand stage, please clear all levels in the previous one.

status.select_level: Please select a level from the list on the left before running.
status.select_to_begin: Select a level to begin the mission.

1.title: The Accumulator
1.description: A comprehensive review of the basics of registers/ALU, flags, jumps, and loops.

2.title: The Stack
2.description: Master the concepts of saving, reordering, and stack calculations centered around push/pop.

01_Mov&Call.name: Mov & Call
01_Mov&Call.description: Read bytes from stdin (syscall 0), write them to stdout (syscall 1).

02_Addition.name: Addition
02_Addition.description: Read bytes, add 1 to each byte, write result.

03_Subtraction.name: Subtraction
03_Subtraction.description: Read bytes, subtract 1 from each byte, write result.

04_TheXORTrick.name: The XOR Trick
04_TheXORTrick.description: Read bytes, XOR each byte with 0x20, write result.

05_Inc&Dec.name: Inc & Dec
05_Inc&Dec.description: Read bytes. Inc even-indexed bytes, dec odd-indexed bytes, write result.

06_Unconditional.name: Unconditional
06_Unconditional.description: Same as stage 01, but use JMP to structure the control flow.

07_ZeroFlag.name: Zero Flag
07_ZeroFlag.description: Read bytes, replace 0x00 with 0x20 (space), write result.

08_SignFlag.name: Sign Flag
08_SignFlag.description: Read bytes, output '+' if first byte is non-negative, otherwise '-'.

09_Comparison.name: Comparison
09_Comparison.description: Read bytes, compare consecutive bytes, output '+', '=', '-' markers (length N-1).

10_Countdown.name: Countdown
10_Countdown.description: Read one ASCII digit, output a countdown from it to '0'.

11_Accumulate3.name: Accumulate 3
11_Accumulate3.description: Read bytes, sum the first 3 bytes (u8), output 1 byte result.

12_TheAccumulator.name: The Accumulator (BOSS)
12_TheAccumulator.description: Read bytes and transform: A-Z -> a-z, 0-9 -> increment (wrap 9->0), others unchanged.

13_Push&Pop.name: Push & Pop
13_Push&Pop.description: Read A, push/pop it, then output A (1 byte).

14_SwapTwo.name: Swap Two
14_SwapTwo.description: Read A,B and output B,A (2 bytes).

15_Duplicate.name: Duplicate
15_Duplicate.description: Read A and output A,A (2 bytes).

16_Reverse3.name: Reverse 3
16_Reverse3.description: Read A,B,C and output C,B,A (3 bytes).

17_ReverseUntil0.name: Reverse Until 0
17_ReverseUntil0.description: Read values until 0, output them reversed (0 not included).

18_SumFromStack.name: Sum From Stack
18_SumFromStack.description: Read values until 0, sum them, output 1 byte result.

19_SafePop.name: Safe Pop
19_SafePop.description: Process tokens (push/pop) without underflow; output final depth.

20_RPN_AddOnly.name: RPN (Add Only)
20_RPN_AddOnly.description: RPN evaluation: numbers push, -1 add, 0 end; output top.

21_Sort3.name: Sort 3
21_Sort3.description: Read 3 values and output them sorted ascending (3 bytes).

22_Rotate3.name: Rotate 3
22_Rotate3.description: Read A,B,C and output B,C,A (3 bytes).

23_MinMaxFromStack.name: Min & Max From Stack
23_MinMaxFromStack.description: Read values until 0; output min then max (2 bytes).

24_TheStackMachine.name: The Stack Machine (BOSS)
24_TheStackMachine.description: Token machine: +push, -1 add, -2 sub, -3 xor, 0 end; output top.

basics.title: Architecture Basics
basics.description: Learn the basics of CPU, registers, and the MOV instruction.

s1.title: Welcome to the World of Assembly
s1.content:
Assembly language is the language closest to the "machine code" that computers can directly understand.
You can learn how programs actually work on the CPU.

s2.title: CPU and Memory
s2.content:
The **CPU**, the brain of the computer, takes data from **memory** and performs calculations.
Inside the CPU, there are small boxes called **registers** for storing data temporarily.

s3.title: First Instruction: MOV
s3.content:
The **MOV** instruction is for "moving (copying)" data from one place to another.
Writing `mov rax, 123` puts the value `123` into the register `rax`.

exercise.title: Put a Value into RAX
exercise.description: Let's try putting `123` into the register `rax`.
exercise.instruction:
1. Enter `mov rax, 123` into the editor.
2. Click the "Run" button to see if it's correct.
